query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Godi, Fiorenza, poi che se’ sì grande 2 che per mare e per terra batti l’ali, 3 e per lo ’nferno tuo nome si spande!
query.error: **English:** 1 Rejoice, Florence, since you are so great 2 that you beat your wings over sea and land, 3 and your name spreads even through hell!
query.result: 1 Blissað, Florentia, siððan ðu eart swa micel 2 ðæt ðu ofer sæ and ofer eorðan ðine fyðru beate, 3 and ðin nama ðurh helle is awended!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Tra li ladron trovai cinque cotali 5 tuoi cittadini onde mi ven vergogna, 6 e tu in grande orranza non ne sali.
query.error: **English:** 4 Among the thieves I found five such 5 of your citizens that I am ashamed of them, 6 and you do not rise in great honor from it.
query.result: 4 Betwux ðam sceapum ic funde fif swylce 5 ðine burhsittende ðæt me is sceamu, 6 and ðu on micelre arwurðnesse ðær of ne astige.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Ma se presso al mattin del ver si sogna, 8 tu sentirai, di qua da picciol tempo, 9 di quel che Prato, non ch’altri, t’agogna.
query.error: **English:** 7 But if near the morning of truth one dreams, 8 you will hear, from now on a short time, 9 of what Prato, and no one else, yearns for you.
query.result: 7 Ac gif hit bið neah ðære morgene swefnes, 8 ðu gehyrst, heonon lytlum fæce, 9 hwæt ðe Prato, and na ðinra gefera, wilnað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 E se già fosse, non saria per tempo. 11 Così foss’ ei, da che pur esser dee! 12 ché più mi graverà, com’ più m’attempo.
query.error: **English:** 10 And if it were already here, it would not be on time. 11 If only it were here, since it must be! 12 For it will weigh on me more, the older I get.
query.result: 10 And gif hit ða wære, hit nære na for ðam. 11 Swa hit wære, siððan hit beon sceal! 12 Forðam hit me deore wyrðeð, swa ic ieldra beo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Noi ci partimmo, e su per le scalee 14 che n’avea fatto iborni a scender pria, 15 rimontò ’l duca mio e trasse mee;
query.error: **English:** 13 We departed, and up the stairs 14 which had made the unborn weary in descending, 15 my leader climbed again and drew me after him;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 e proseguendo la solinga via, 17 tra le schegge e tra ’ rocchi de lo scoglio 18 lo piè sanza la man non si spedia.
query.error: **English:** 16 and continuing along the solitary way, 17 among the splinters and the rocks of the cliff, 18 the foot without the hand could not advance.
query.result: 16 and ða forð oððe we ða sylfan stige, 17 betwux ða scearpan stan and ða scinan clifu, 18 ðær ðæs fotes spor oððe ðære handa ne mihte furðor cuman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Allor mi dolsi, e ora mi ridoglio 20 quando drizzo la mente a ciò ch’io vidi, 21 e più lo ’ngegno affreno ch’i’ non soglio,
query.error: **English:** 19 Then I grieved, and now I grieve again 20 when I turn my mind to what I saw, 21 and I restrain my intellect more than I am wont,
query.result: 19 Þa ic me geomrode, and nu ic me geomrige, 20 þonne ic ðone mód on ða gemynd sette, 21 and ðone ingeþonc fæste gebunden hæbbe,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 perché non corra che virtù nol guidi; 23 sì che, se stella bona o miglior cosa 24 m’ha dato ’l ben, ch’io stessi nol m’invidi.
query.error: **English:** 22 so that it may not run where virtue does not guide it; 23 so that, if a good star or a better thing 24 has given me the good that I have, I may not begrudge it to myself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Quante ’l villan ch’al poggio si riposa, 26 nel tempo che colui che ’l mondo schiara 27 la faccia sua a noi tien meno ascosa,
query.error: **English:** 25 How many fireflies the peasant sees at rest on the hillside, 26 at the time when he who lights the world 27 keeps his face less hidden from us,
query.result: 25 Swa fela firgenstreamas se ceorl gesihð 26 on ðam timan ðe se ðe ðone weorold leoht 27 his ansyn us læs dyrne hæfð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 come la mosca cede a la zanzara, 29 vede lucciole giù per la vallea, 30 forse colà dov’ e’ vendemmia e ara:

query.result: 28 swa ða mucgge ðone fleogan lætað, 29 gesihð niðer on ðam dene, 30 mæg ðær winigeard wyrcean and erian:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 di tante fiamme tutta risplendea 32 l’ottava bolgia, sì com’ io m’accorsi 33 tosto che fui là ’ve ’l fondo parea.

query.result: 31 of ðam ligum eall lixte wæs 32 ðæt eahtoðe leg, swa ic ða onfand 33 ða ic ðær wæs ðær ðæs grundes wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 34 And swa swa se ðe mid berum wraec, 35 geseah Helies waen on ðam upastige, 36 ða ða ða hors to heofenum urnon,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 che nol potea sì con li occhi seguire, 38 ch’el vedesse altro che la fiamma sola, 39 sì come nuvoletta, in sù salire:

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 tal si move ciascuna per la gola 41 del fosso, ché nessuna mostra ’l furto, 42 e ogne fiamma un peccatore invola.
query.error: **English:** 40 so each one moves through the gullet 41 of the ditch, for none shows the theft, 42 and each flame steals a sinner.
query.result: 40 swa faerð gehwylc ðurh ðæs grafes ðrote, 41 ðaet nan ne bið ðæs dieftes gesyne, 42 and aelc lig byrð synnigne mannan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Io stava sovra ’l ponte a veder surto, 44 sì che s’io non avessi un ronchion preso, 45 caduto sarei giù sanz’ esser urto.
query.error: **English:** 43 I stood upon the bridge to watch the surge, 44 so that if I had not seized a branch, 45 I would have fallen down without being pushed.
query.result: 43 Ic stód ofer ðære bricge to geseonne ðone yþ, 44 swa ðæt gif ic næfde án twig genumen, 45 ic wäre feallen niðer butan ænigum styrunge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 E ’l duca che mi vide tanto atteso, 47 disse: «Dentro dai fuochi son li spirti; 48 catun si fascia di quel ch’elli è inceso».
query.error: **English:** 46 And the leader who saw me so intent, 47 said: "Within the fires are the spirits; 48 each one wraps himself in that which burns him."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 «Maestro mio», rispuos’ io, «per udirti 50 son io più certo; ma già m’era avviso 51 che così fosse, e già voleva dirti:
query.error: **English:** 49 "My master," I replied, "to hear you, 50 I am more certain; but already I had guessed 51 that it was so, and already I wanted to ask you:
query.result: 49 "Laresave min," ic ða cwæð, "for ðinum wordum 50 ic eom ðe geornor; ac me ær ðuhte 51 ðæt hit swa wære, and ic ðe wolde frignan:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 chi è ’n quel foco che vien sì diviso 53 di sopra, che par surger de la pira 54 dov’ Eteòcle col fratel fu miso?».

query.result: 52 hwa is se on ðam fyre ðe ðær fyr cymð 53 toforan, ðæt hit ðinceð ðæt hit stige 54 of ðam ade ðær Eteocles mid his breðer wæs aled?"

query.result: 73 Læt me sprecan, ðe ic hæbbe oncnawen 74 ðæt ðu woldest; ðeah ðe hi wæron sceoh, 75 forðæm ðe hi wæron Grecas, ðinre spræce.

115 d’i nostri sensi ch’è del rimanente 116 non vogliate negar l’esperïenza, 117 di retro al sol, del mondo sanza gente.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Considerate la vostra semenza: 119 fatti non foste a viver come bruti, 120 ma per seguir virtute e canoscenza”.

query.result: 118 Beoðeð gemyndige eowres sædes: 119 ne wæron ge geworhte ðæt ge lifdon swa ða unwisan, 120 ac ðæt ge folgodon mæðe and wisdom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Li miei compagni fec’ io sì aguti, 122 con questa orazion picciola, al cammino, 123 che a pena poscia li avrei ritenuti;

124 e volta nostra poppa nel mattino, 125 de’ remi facemmo ali al folle volo, 126 sempre acquistando dal lato mancino.

query.result: 124 and wendon ða urne stefn on ðone morgen, 125 ðara ara ða worhton we ðam wodan fleoge, 126 symle ðone wynstran healf geornlice secende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Tutte le stelle già de l’altro polo 128 vedea la notte, e ’l nostro tanto basso, 129 che non surgëa fuor del marin suolo.

query.result: 127 Ealle ða steorran ðæs oðres steorran 128 ða niht geseah, and ure swa niðer, 129 ðæt he ne aras ofer ðæs sæes grund.

query.prompt:

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 quando n’apparve una montagna, bruna 134 per la distanza, e parvemi alta tanto 135 quanto veduta non avëa alcuna.

query.result: 133 ða ðær beforan us beorgas stodon 134 brune on ðære mistceo, and ða beorgas wæron 135 swilce we ær ne sægon under swegle.
